channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2024021030
item.description:
Report X-2024021030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: TOPEKA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET PACKAGE BROUGHT TO QA FOR INSPECTION UPON INSPECTION FOUND IT TO BE A DAMAGED HAZMAT SUCURED THE AREA PUT PACKAGE IN YELLOW HAZMAT TUBE WITH LIENER IN HOUSE CLEAN UPOUTSIDE OF THE BOX LOOKS LIKE IT WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AT AT ONE POINT 4:39AM THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE WITH A LOSE CAP CAUSING INTERNARL LEAKAGE DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: FELLOW red orentation arrows

  • Description: Approximately 2 gallons of FLASH CLENE 1414 was released from one 330-gallon plastic tote due to improper packaging. No Drains, Soils, or Waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report X-2024020699
item.description:
Report X-2024020699

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-28
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTIFIED QA OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE. QA PLACED THE LEAKING PAIL IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PAIL WAS DROPPED AND BOTTOM CRACKED CAUSING CONTENTS TO SPILL OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024020371
item.description:
Report E-2024020371

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-21
  • City: Centerville
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COFFEYVILLE RESOUCES CRUDE TRANSPORTATION, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Transport was headed West on CR1077, when the vehicle failed to negotiate the curve that curved back South. Driver stated he looked away from the roadway to check on an empty water bottle, when his steer tire went over the shoulder. The driver decided not to correct the transport, striking trees and caution chevrons, overturning the transport and splitting the trailer in half on impact. The trailer released the entire load 154 barrels. Safety was immediately dispatched from Coffeyville Resources to start clean up and remediation. The Kansas Highway Patrol was dispatched at the time of the incident, the road was diverted while the transport and trailer was towed. Clean up began on 01/21 but was delayed due to weather conditions (rain and ice). The soil has been dug up and transported to a landfill. The Coffeyville Resources Pipeline group hauled Vac trucks of the water used to keep the soil from continuing to be contaminated to the Coffeyville Refinery. The clean up was completed on 2/16.
